subject: Re: [junit] Can we have multiple runs for a single test method of the Unit test case
msgSnippet: Hello David, Thanks for your reply, I want to run the same code but with different data five times. thanks in advance, Mohan saff@mit.edu wrote: Mohan, Were
messageBody:
Hello David,

Thanks for your reply,
I want to run the same code but with different data five times.

thanks in advance,
Mohan

saff@... wrote:
Mohan,

Were you hoping to run the exact same code five times, or change the data each
time? I think Cedric and I read your code two different ways. Thanks,

David Saff

Quoting CÃ©dric Beust â <cbeust@...>:

> On 11/22/05, saff@... <saff@...> wrote:
> > Mohan,
> >
> > Generally, this is tackled using the Parameterized Test Case
> > pattern. It's
> > described well in Rainsberger's book "JUnit Recipes", but here's a recent
> > example from the list (thanks, Elliotte). Share and Enjoy,
> Here is how TestNG does it (please consider this for inclusion in JUnit 4):
>
> @Test(invocationCount = 5)
> public void testMethod() {
> ...
> }
